content.question:
The distribution of 27 salaries at a small company has mean $35,000 and standard deviation $2,000. Suppose the company hires a <math alttext="twenty eighth" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>28</mn><mtext>th</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> employee at a salary of $120,000. Which of the following claims about the new salary distribution is supported?
The median is not likely to change.
The range is not likely to change.
The mean is likely to increase.

choices.label: <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> only

<math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>III</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> only

<math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>III</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>III</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> only

topic.text: 1.7: Summary Statistics for a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
